intro: Omalotheca leucopilina, commonly known as the white-pilose omalotheca, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in the summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely studied for its ecological role.
